name: Jo
tagline: Make fast, efficient web apps with JavaScript
body:
# Build web apps for 23 targets and counting

|                   | Chrome | Safari | FireFox | IE    | Built-In  | PhoneGap / Cordova |
|-------------------|--------|--------|---------|-------|-----------|--------------------|
| iOS 5+            | YES    | YES    | YES     |       |           | YES                |
| Android 4.1+      | YES    |        | YES     |       | YES       | YES                |
| Windows Phone 8+  |        |        |         | YES   |           | YES                |
| Mac OSX           | YES    | YES    | YES     |       |           |                    |
| Windows 8+        | YES    |        | YES     | YES   |           |                    |
| ChromeOS          | YES    |        |         |       |           |                    |
| Linux             | YES    |        | YES     |       |           |                    |
| BlackBerry 10     |        |        |         |       | YES       | YES                |
| FireFox OS        |        |        | YES     |       |           |                    |
| Tizen             |        |        |         |       | YES       |                    |

And any other platform which has high HTML5 standards (mostly CSS3 support).

# Build more with less code

Jo is a lightweight library for making modern web apps.

- Makes fast, single-page apps
- Small footprint
- Develop locally with your favorite editor
- Use your favorite build tools
- Made with pure JavaScript and CSS
- It's open source (BSD-3 license)

| File Type      | Raw Size | Minified | Gzipped  |
| *.js           | ~135K    | ~65K     | **~16K** |
| *.css          | ~22K     | ~16K     | **~4K**  |
| (font glyphs)  | ~11K     |          | **~8K**  |
|----------------|----------|----------|----------|
| Total          |          |          | **~28K** |

# Build with confidence

Jo was first released in April, 2010, and since then it's had over 40,000 downloads.

# Status

Looking for help with:

- platform testing
- example apps
- tutorials
- community management
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
